title: Shocking! Cricket league featuring Gayle, Praveen Kumar in chaos after organisers flee

title: Jaipur tragedy: 12 dead as speeding trailer truck rams vehicles; locals block road

The truck, moving at high speed, lost control near Lohamandi, causing widespread panic and chaos. Emergency services responded swiftly to rescue and aid the injured.

He has not yet received NHS psychiatric care and his family's business has collapsed. Ramesh finds Air India's interim compensation inadequate for his needs.

description: India's women's cricket team has achieved a historic maiden World Cup victory, sparking a massive 456.5% surge in conversations on X (formerly Twitter) within 24 hours. The nation erupted in celebration after the team's dominant performance against South Africa. This monumental win, lauded by figures like Virat Kohli, Sundar Pichai, and Satya Nadella, marks a new era for women's cricket in India and inspires future generations.

description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian says Tehran will rebuild its bombed nuclear facilities “with greater strength”, insisting the country is not pursuing nuclear weapons.

title: Powerful earthquake in Russia: 5.8 magnitude quake jolts Kamchatka region
description: A powerful 6.4 magnitude earthquake has shaken the east coast of Russia's Kamchatka region. The tremor occurred at a depth of 28 kilometers. No injuries have been reported so far. The Kamchatka Peninsula is part of the Pacific Ring of Fire, an area known for frequent seismic activity due to shifting tectonic plates. This is a developing story.

Why we see things in the dark: How our brains work in absence of light
description: Our brains actively construct vision in near-darkness, blending residual light with memory and prediction.  Even with minimal visual input, the brain maintains coherence, relying on internal models and neural networks for spatial awareness.  Optimal light levels boost cognitive function, while dim or bright conditions cause fatigue, highlighting the brain's intricate relationship with illumination.

title: 'Things falling, people running': Powerful earthquake rattles Afghanistan - Watch
description: A powerful 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck northern Afghanistan near Mazar-e-Sharif, claiming at least 20 lives and injuring over 300. The quake, occurring at a depth of 28 kilometers, caused widespread destruction, damaging buildings and a holy shrine. Afghanistan's location on tectonic plate boundaries makes it highly prone to such seismic activity.

title: Trump claims Pakistan among nations conducting nuclear tests, defends US’ decision to resume testing- Key takeaways from his interview
'Pakistan conducting nuclear tests': Trump makes big claim
description: US President Donald Trump claimed Pakistan, Russia, China, and North Korea are conducting nuclear tests, justifying the US's decision to resume its own after over 30 years. He stated testing is necessary to ensure the reliability of American weapons systems, citing recent trials by Russia. Energy Secretary Chris Wright later clarified that discussions involved non-critical system tests, not full nuclear explosions.

description: During a meeting in Gyeongju, Chinese President Xi Jinping gifted South Korean President Lee Jae-myung two Xiaomi smartphones. Lee humorously inquired about communication security, to which Xi responded with a lighthearted remark about checking for backdoors, drawing laughter. The exchange occurred amidst ongoing global concerns over Chinese technology and espionage.

The court, taking suo motu cognizance, also permitted dog bite victims to participate in the hearing. Justices expressed intent to issue orders concerning government institutions supporting dogs on their premises.

Why Dubai and Johannesburg are known as the 'City of Gold'?
description: Dubai and Johannesburg, both known as the "City of Gold," share a profound connection to the precious metal. Dubai leads global gold trade, symbolizing modern luxury and innovation, while Johannesburg's history is rooted in the 1880s gold rush, evolving into Africa's economic powerhouse. Both cities embody ambition and prosperity, their legacies intrinsically linked to gold.

Your zodiac sign is 2,000 years out of date
description: Your zodiac sign may be inaccurate. Ancient astronomers based signs on constellations. Earth's wobble has shifted these star patterns over 2,000 years. Today, Western astrology uses seasonal signs, not star positions. Indian astrology aligns with star movements. Astronomy and astrology separated long ago. Belief in astrology persists due to its adaptability.

Choke’s on you: Delhi AQI inches towards ‘severe’ at five stations
description: Delhi's air quality plunged to a season-high 'very poor' AQI of 388 on Sunday, with forecasts predicting a move to 'severe' by Tuesday. Afternoon winds offered temporary relief, but stagnant conditions are trapping pollutants.  Several monitoring stations already registered severe levels, highlighting the onset of the city's most polluted period.

title: Telangana man kills wife, sister-in-law, child over family dispute, ends life; elder daughter survives
description: A 40-year-old daily labourer in Hyderabad allegedly murdered his wife, sister-in-law, and 10-year-old daughter with a machete following a domestic dispute. His 15-year-old daughter survived the attack and alerted neighbours. The accused then took his own life.

title: Bihar polls: Rahul Gandhi dives into Begusarai pond, joins locals in catching fish
description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi surprised locals in Begusarai by joining fishermen for a dip and fish catch in a village pond after an election rally. He then visited a local family's home, bathing at a handpump and taking a selfie before departing.

title: The return of the G-2 duopoly: US, China embrace leaves India out in the cold
description: US President Donald Trump has declared China a functional equal, signaling a new G-2 duopoly that sidelines other global powers. This marks a significant policy shift, moving away from viewing China as an existential threat. The move suggests a strategic realignment prioritizing US-China cooperation for global stability and success.

title: Consumed by AI: Sam Altman admits OpenAI is consuming him; calls it ‘a little sad’
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed envy for today's young entrepreneurs, particularly college dropouts, citing the vast opportunities and advanced AI tools that enable rapid product development.  He also reflected on the personal cost of leading OpenAI, admitting the company consumes his mental space, preventing him from pursuing new startup ideas.
